Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Step 1: Analyze the Input Log The log contains: - Timestamps - Actions (FOCUS, TYPING, SWITCH, CLICK, SCROLL, SAVE, HIGHLIGHT, CLOSE) - App Name - Window Title - Other details (Keys, Action descriptions, Direction, Text) Sequence of Events: 1. 08:59:50 - Focus Word (Quarterly_Report.docx) ... 26. 09:08:15 - Close Word (Quarterly_Report.docx)

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: Step 2: Case Identification Strategy There are a few ways to define a Case here. Option A: Case = Document/File... Option B: Case = Work Session / Project... Option C: Case = Task based on window title context.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Narrative hypothesis: The user is working on a Quarterly Report... They start drafting content in Document1 (maybe a draft section). They check/respond to an email about the Annual Meeting (context gathering or communication). They look at a PDF draft (reference). They update the budget figures in Excel (data gathering). They go back to Document1 to reference the budget. They close Document1. They work on Quarterly_Report.docx (Executive Summary).

Name: Inductive Reasoning - IND
Text: If I group by the Window Title (File/Subject), I get distinct processes. Case: Document1.docx ... Problem with Case = File: It misses the connection. The user updated Excel specifically to reference it in Document1.

Name: Backtracking - IND
Text: Alternative Interpretation: Case = Project Quarterly Preparation... Lets go back to Case = Document/File but with a twist... Proposed Strategy: I will group events into cases based on the primary artifact (document/file) being worked on.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The evidence (Inserting reference to budget) confirms this. So, I can create a Case for Document1 that includes the sub-tasks (PDF review, Excel update). What about the Email? ... lack of textual connection to the other files.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Final Check on Logic: - Case Logic: I identified three primary case IDs based on distinct Work Items. Document1.docx serves as a Master Case for a sub-workflow involving a PDF and Excel file... - Activity Logic: Low-level actions... mapped to process steps.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: In process mining, we want to see the full trace of work required to complete the case. The case completion condition is Close Document. The work done on PDF and Excel was intermediate steps required to finish the document.
